text: Then I knelt down and, taking my foot in his lap, as shoes do, took off his shoes and socks and kissed his feet. I had started with order and without hurry, but as I took off his clothes I grew in my mind I did not know what a furor of humility and worship. Perhaps it was the same feeling I sometimes experienced after praying; but it was the first time I felt it for a man; and I was happy to realize that it was true love, away from all sensuality and vice. Fragment from The Roman, 1947
title: Amor verdadero
author: Alberto Moravia
